subject: Re: JUnit test executor.
msgSnippet: FWIW, I know that I and most of my colleagues rather having the test-executer close and overhead-free(ish). Running my tests from the shell or IDE with a few
messageBody:
FWIW, I know that I and most of my colleagues rather having the
test-executer "close" and overhead-free(ish).
Running my tests from the shell or IDE with a few clicks/key-presses
is a strong requirement.
I think that the web environment is an overkill.
But it may just be me.

Cheers,
Aviv.
